intro: Comptonia ceterach, commonly known as the narrowleaf stiltgrass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant typically grows in wet, swampy areas and has slender, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in clusters, followed by small, capsule-like fruits. Comptonia ceterach plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
